page.title: 12FARMLAND ROUND E GRINSTEAD
page.content: This 12 km block to the south west of East Grinstead is primarily farmland with the odd patch of cultivated coniferous woodland and some remaining areas of deciduous woods, some mamaged, some not. The farms, of which there are about 10,are generally mixed. There are roughly equal numbers of beef & dairy cattle, often both being present on the same farm. There are sheep, but very few pigs. The farms all have considerable amounts of grassland to serve these animals both as cultivated pasture and as meadows for hay & silage. Few farms are without some land devoted to crops, wheat, barley & oats being the most common. This combination gives a pleasant & attractive landscape. The terrain is gently undulating and crossed by many streams. Fields are small and bounded by hedgerows.
